ul.li1: 1My child, do not forget my instruction,
ul.li2: and may your heart guard my commands.
ul.li1: 2For length of days, years of life,
ul.li2: and peace theyThat is, “my commands” (3:1) shall add to you.
ul.li1: 3May loyal loveOr “kindness, mercy” and truth not forsake you;
ul.li2: bind them around your neck,
write them upon your heart.
ul.li1: 4And you shall find favor and good senseOr “understanding, prudence”
ul.li2: in the eyes of God and humankind.
ul.li1: 5Trust YahwehLiterally “trust toward Yahweh” with all your heart;
ul.li2: do not lean toward your own understanding.
ul.li1: 6In all your ways acknowledge him,
ul.li2: and he will straighten your paths.
ul.li1: 7Do not be wise in your own eyes;
ul.li2: fear Yahweh and retreat from evil.
ul.li1: 8There shall be healing for your flesh,Literally “navel”
ul.li2: and refreshment for your body.
ul.li1: 9Honor Yahweh from your substance,Or “wealth, property”
ul.li2: and from the firstfruits of all that will come to you,
ul.li1: 10and your barns shall be full of plenty,
ul.li2: and your vats shall burst with new wine.

chapter.pericope: Happy Is the One Who Finds Wisdom

ul.li1: 11Do not despise the discipline of Yahweh, my child.
ul.li2: Do not be weary of his reproof
ul.li1: 12because whomever Yahweh will love, he will rebuke,
ul.li2: as a father delights in his son.
ul.li1: 13Happy is the oneLiterally “a man” who finds wisdom,
ul.li2: and one who obtains understanding.
ul.li1: 14For herOr “its”; both “wisdom” and “understanding” are feminine nouns and can be read as either “she” or “it” income is better than the income of silver,
ul.li2: and her revenue than that of gold.
ul.li1: 15She is more precious than rubies,
ul.li2: and all your desires shall not compare with her.
ul.li1: 16Length of days is in her right hand;
ul.li2: in her left hand are riches and honor.
ul.li1: 17Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
ul.li2: and all her paths are peace.
ul.li1: 18She is a tree of life for those who seize her;
ul.li2: those who take hold of her are considered happy.

chapter.pericope: Role of Wisdom in Creation and Society

ul.li1: 19Yahweh in wisdom founded the earth;
ul.li2: he established the heavens in understanding.
ul.li1: 20With his knowledge, depths broke open,
ul.li2: and clouds dropped dew.
ul.li1: 21My child, may theyGrammatically, “they” most likely refers to clouds (3:20). In context, “they” may refer to wisdom and understanding (3:13). not escape from your sight;Literally “eyes”
ul.li2: may you keep sound wisdom and prudence.
ul.li1: 22They shall be life for your soulOr “inner self”
ul.li2: and adornmentOr “favor” for your neck.
ul.li1: 23Then you will walk in the confidence of your ways,
ul.li2: and your foot will not stumble.
ul.li1: 24If you sit down, you will not panic,Or “fear, dread”
ul.li2: and if you lie down, then your sleep shall be sweet.
ul.li1: 25Do not be afraid of sudden panic,Or “fear, dread”
ul.li2: or the storm of wickedness that will come.
ul.li1: 26Yahweh will be your confidenceLiterally “in your confidence”
ul.li2: and guard your foot from capture.
ul.li1: 27Do not withhold good from its ownerOr “lord”
ul.li2: when it is in the power of your hand to do.
ul.li1: 28Do not say to your neighbor,
ul.li2: “Go and return and tomorrow I will give it,”
when it is with you.Literally “and there is with you”
ul.li1: 29Do not plot harm against your neighbor
ul.li2: who dwells in confidence beside you.
ul.li1: 30Do not quarrel with anyone without cause,
ul.li2: when he did not do you harm.
ul.li1: 31Do not envy a man of violence,
ul.li2: and do not choose any of his ways,
ul.li1: 32for he who is perverse is an abomination of Yahweh,
ul.li2: but those who are upright are his confidence.
ul.li1: 33The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked,
ul.li2: and the abode of the righteous ones he blesses.
ul.li1: 34With those who scorn, he is scornful,
ul.li2: but to those who are humble, he gives favor.
ul.li1: 35They will inherit the honor of the wise,
ul.li2: but stubborn fools, disgrace.
